data.title: Delicious Vietnamese meals and French bakery
data.text: This is owner Alice's restaurant decorated with mementos of her travels and featuring delicious Vietnamese and Southeast Asian lunches and dinners and baked goods born of her training in France.  Vietnamese sandwiches are a steal at $3.00, and huge soup. rice or noodle based meals range from about $7 to $8.  If in doubt, order a combination plate with BBQ pork, beef, and egg rolls with vermicelli and salad--$8.95.  There are also croissant sandwiches made to order.

data.title: Great Local "Mom and Pop" Restaurant
data.text:
Vietnamese cuisine (i.e. pho, noodles, etc.) with prices from $8.00 to $9.50+. Stronger Vietnamese style hot/iced coffee (as a change from the usual Starbucks or Peets). There is a bakery with pastries (around $2.00) to go with that coffee if you want a simple coffee break instead. Adequate seating. Parking in a fenced off area by the restaurant or just across the street in a municipal free parking lot. 

Friendly staff. One person on duty so depending on the crowd, be a bit patient. Reminded me of the local mom and pop restaurants in Honolulu as a child. Sit back and enjoy a slower paced dining experience in a local place.

data.title: Great Restaurant in Hayward
data.text: This is absolutely, a must restaurant to visit and enjoy the appetizers, entrees, the pastries, sandwiches and more....  Alice is the owner and she is a delightful and personal individual, her son, daughter, husband and other relatives are there to assist her regularly.  Going to Le Paradis is like dining at home.  Very, nice atmosphere as well as smiles and glad to accommodate you on your  choice of meal!  My husband loves the Pho, he could eat their every day.  I enjoy the fresh Spring Rolls or the hot ones also, the vermicelli dishes too.  If I should decide not to cook, we get in the car and he says; well where shall we go, and all the time he is going straight to Le Paradis.  It doesn't matter what you order you will enjoy it?  Don't take my word for it, just go there and "Try It You'll Like It!"

data.title: Pay a visit to our friend and owner of the restaurant
data.text: The restaurant is truly dress as very fine restaurant and we missed their foods that are more influenced by experienced from Paris and Vietnam which is truly reflected on their served foods.  The cost is reasonable and very worthy for the price.  They have also a bakery that made a specialty bread, cakes, cookies, etc.  Dislike none

data.title: Terrific made to order pastries and cakes
data.text: This Vietnamese restaurant and French style bakery is one of my haunts in Hayward. To get the best pastries and cakes, ask them to make them and they will be fresh and expertly made and quite reasonable in price.  The Vietnamese food is good.  I like their Bun Bo Hue, the spicy beef noodle soup.  The broth is very good and the noodles still have some spring.  They use the right herbs.

data.title: The outside looks better than the inside
data.text: Driven past this restaurant for years and decided to try it.  It is so small that you can see the restaurant, bakery and kitchen as you walk in.  The tables and chairs are old and creaky.  The owner, Alice, was our server.  We ordered the Shrimp and Pork Spring Rolls with peanut sauce.  On the menu is says “Fresh”.  Spring roll tasted old and we could not finish it.  The Chicken Teriyaki with steamed rice plus the Egg omelette with tomato, shrimp and steamed rice which we ordered were sub par.  Not sure how she keeps in business but I will not be back.

data.title: Fits the bill for a quick and delicious bite to eat
data.text: We just wanted to get a quick bite before heading off to Costco and we found this little gem.  The food is tasty.  We ordered a strawberry smoothie, the chow mein special and chicken, shrimp and eggroll bun.  Delish!

data.title: Not the best, not the worst
data.text: Only one rating here so far, lots on Yelp, but I have to say average food (we ordered number 30) in a place with absolutely no ambiance. Had better Vietnamese, much better. Good thing is they have their own parking lot, however there is a lot of on street parking also.

data.title: Good food; Priced Right
data.text: Prices were right!  You won't believe the prices listed on the menu for the food that you got. There weren't (m)any pictures on the menu (but some on the walls), so come knowing what you want, or you can always ask the waiter/waitress, who seemed to be the owner.  We ordered some soup noodle dishes, rice dishes and the Vietnamese spring rolls.  Everything came out great.  We didn't order dessert, but they do have it there.  They won't rush you at all; we were a larger party and they let us linger over our food and coffees.  Parking is in a private lot with a few spots or across the street in a bigger lot.
